1.verse: Paul, an apostle of Jesus Christ, according to a command of  God our Saviour, and of the Lord Jesus Christ our hope,

2.verse: to Timotheus -- genuine child in faith: Grace, kindness,  peace, from God our Father, and Christ Jesus our Lord,

3.verse: according as I did exhort thee to remain in Ephesus -- I  going on to Macedonia -- that thou mightest charge certain not  to teach any other thing,

4.verse: nor to give heed to fables and endless genealogies, that  cause questions rather than the building up of God that is in  faith: --

5.verse: And the end of the charge is love out of a pure heart, and  of a good conscience, and of faith unfeigned,

6.verse: from which certain, having swerved, did turn aside to vain  discourse,

7.verse: willing to be teachers of law, not understanding either the  things they say, nor concerning what they asseverate,

8.verse: and we have known that the law [is] good, if any one may use  it lawfully;

9.verse: having known this, that for a righteous man law is not set,  but for lawless and insubordinate persons, ungodly and  sinners, impious and profane, parricides and matricides,  men-slayers,

10.verse: whoremongers, sodomites, men-stealers, liars, perjured  persons, and if there be any other thing that to sound  doctrine is adverse,

11.verse: according to the good news of the glory of the blessed God,  with which I was entrusted.

12.verse: And I give thanks to him who enabled me -- Christ Jesus our  Lord -- that he did reckon me stedfast, having put [me] to the  ministration,

13.verse: who before was speaking evil, and persecuting, and  insulting, but I found kindness, because, being ignorant, I did  [it] in unbelief,

14.verse: and exceedingly abound did the grace of our Lord, with  faith and love that [is] in Christ Jesus:

15.verse: stedfast [is] the word, and of all acceptation worthy, that  Christ Jesus came to the world to save sinners -- first of whom  I am;

16.verse: but because of this I found kindness, that in me first  Jesus Christ might shew forth all long-suffering, for a pattern  of those about to believe on him to life age-during:

17.verse: and to the King of the ages, the incorruptible, invisible,  only wise God, [is] honour and glory -- to the ages of the  ages! Amen.

18.verse: This charge I commit to thee, child Timotheus, according to  the prophesies that went before upon thee, that thou mayest war  in them the good warfare,

19.verse: having faith and a good conscience, which certain having  thrust away, concerning the faith did make shipwreck,

20.verse: of whom are Hymenaeus and Alexander, whom I did deliver to  the Adversary, that they might be instructed not to speak  evil.

1.verse: I exhort, then, first of all, there be made supplications,  prayers, intercessions, thanksgivings, for all men:

2.verse: for kings, and all who are in authority, that a quiet and  peaceable life we may lead in all piety and gravity,

3.verse: for this [is] right and acceptable before God our Saviour,

4.verse: who doth will all men to be saved, and to come to the full  knowledge of the truth;

5.verse: for one [is] God, one also [is] mediator of God and of men,  the man Christ Jesus,

6.verse: who did give himself a ransom for all -- the testimony in  its own times --

7.verse: in regard to which I was set a preacher and apostle -- truth  I say in Christ, I do not lie -- a teacher of nations, in faith  and truth.

8.verse: I wish, therefore, that men pray in every place, lifting up  kind hands, apart from anger and reasoning;

9.verse: in like manner also the women, in becoming apparel, with  modesty and sobriety to adorn themselves, not in braided hair,  or gold, or pearls, or garments of great price,

10.verse: but -- which becometh women professing godly piety --  through good works.

11.verse: Let a woman in quietness learn in all subjection,

12.verse: and a woman I do not suffer to teach, nor to rule a  husband, but to be in quietness,

13.verse: for Adam was first formed, then Eve,

14.verse: and Adam was not deceived, but the woman, having been  deceived, into transgression came,

15.verse: and she shall be saved through the child-bearing, if they  remain in faith, and love, and sanctification, with sobriety.

1.verse: Stedfast [is] the word: If any one the oversight doth long  for, a right work he desireth;

2.verse: it behoveth, therefore, the overseer to be blameless, of one  wife a husband, vigilant, sober, decent, a friend of  strangers, apt to teach,

3.verse: not given to wine, not a striker, not given to filthy lucre,  but gentle, not contentious, not a lover of money,

4.verse: his own house leading well, having children in subjection  with all gravity,

5.verse: (and if any one his own house [how] to lead hath not known,  how an assembly of God shall he take care of?)

6.verse: not a new convert, lest having been puffed up he may fall to  a judgment of the devil;

7.verse: and it behoveth him also to have a good testimony from those  without, that he may not fall into reproach and a snare of the  devil.

8.verse: Ministrants -- in like manner grave, not double-tongued, not  given to much wine, not given to filthy lucre,

9.verse: having the secret of the faith in a pure conscience,

10.verse: and let these also first be proved, then let them minister,  being unblameable.

11.verse: Women -- in like manner grave, not false accusers,  vigilant, faithful in all things.

12.verse: Ministrants -- let them be of one wife husbands; the  children leading well, and their own houses,

13.verse: for those who did minister well a good step to themselves  do acquire, and much boldness in faith that [is] in Christ  Jesus.

14.verse: These things I write to thee, hoping to come unto thee  soon,

15.verse: and if I delay, that thou mayest know how it behoveth  [thee] to conduct thyself in the house of God, which is an  assembly of the living God -- a pillar and foundation of the  truth,

16.verse: and, confessedly, great is the secret of piety -- God was  manifested in flesh, declared righteous in spirit, seen by  messengers, preached among nations, believed on in the world,  taken up in glory!

1.verse: And the Spirit expressly speaketh, that in latter times  shall certain fall away from the faith, giving heed to  seducing spirits and teachings of demons,

2.verse: in hypocrisy speaking lies, being seared in their own  conscience,

3.verse: forbidding to marry -- to abstain from meats that God  created to be received with thanksgiving by those believing  and acknowledging the truth,

4.verse: because every creature of God [is] good, and nothing [is] to  be rejected, with thanksgiving being received,

5.verse: for it is sanctified through the word of God and  intercession.

6.verse: These things placing before the brethren, thou shalt be a  good ministrant of Jesus Christ, being nourished by the words  of the faith, and of the good teaching, which thou didst  follow after,

7.verse: and the profane and old women's fables reject thou, and  exercise thyself unto piety,

8.verse: for the bodily exercise is unto little profit, and the piety  is to all things profitable, a promise having of the life that  now is, and of that which is coming;

9.verse: stedfast [is] the word, and of all acceptation worthy;

10.verse: for for this we both labour and are reproached, because we  hope on the living God, who is Saviour of all men --  especially of those believing.

12.verse: let no one despise thy youth, but a pattern become thou of  those believing in word, in behaviour, in love, in spirit, in  faith, in purity;

13.verse: till I come, give heed to the reading, to the exhortation,  to the teaching;

14.verse: be not careless of the gift in thee, that was given thee  through prophecy, with laying on of the hands of the eldership;

15.verse: of these things be careful; in these things be, that thy  advancement may be manifest in all things;

16.verse: take heed to thyself, and to the teaching; remain in them,  for this thing doing, both thyself thou shalt save, and those  hearing thee.

1.verse: An aged person thou mayest not rebuke, but be entreating as  a father; younger persons as brethren;

2.verse: aged women as mothers, younger ones as sisters -- in all  purity;

3.verse: honour widows who are really widows;

4.verse: and if any widow have children or grandchildren, let them  learn first to their own house to show piety, and to give back  a recompense to the parents, for this is right and acceptable  before God.

5.verse: And she who is really a widow and desolate, hath hoped upon  God, and doth remain in the supplications and in the prayers  night and day,

6.verse: and she who is given to luxury, living -- hath died;

7.verse: and these things charge, that they may be blameless;

8.verse: and if any one for his own -- and especially for those of  the household -- doth not provide, the faith he hath denied,  and than an unbeliever he is worse.

9.verse: A widow -- let her not be enrolled under sixty years of age,  having been a wife of one husband,

10.verse: in good works being testified to: if she brought up  children, if she entertained strangers, if saints' feet she  washed, if those in tribulation she relieved, if every good  work she followed after;

11.verse: and younger widows be refusing, for when they may revel  against the Christ, they wish to marry,

12.verse: having judgment, because the first faith they did cast  away,

13.verse: and at the same time also, they learn [to be] idle, going  about the houses; and not only idle, but also tattlers and  busybodies, speaking the things they ought not;

14.verse: I wish, therefore, younger ones to marry, to bear children,  to be mistress of the house, to give no occasion to the  opposer to reviling;

15.verse: for already certain did turn aside after the Adversary.

16.verse: If any believing man or believing woman have widows, let  them relieve them, and let not the assembly be burdened, that  those really widows it may relieve.

17.verse: The well-leading elders of double honour let them be  counted worthy, especially those labouring in word and  teaching,

18.verse: for the Writing saith, `An ox treading out thou shalt not  muzzle,' and `Worthy [is] the workman of his reward.'

19.verse: Against an elder an accusation receive not, except upon two  or three witnesses.

20.verse: Those sinning, reprove before all, that the others also may  have fear;

21.verse: I testify fully, before God and the Lord Jesus Christ, and  the choice messengers, that these things thou mayest keep,  without forejudging, doing nothing by partiality.

22.verse: Be laying hands quickly on no one, nor be having fellowship  with sins of others; be keeping thyself pure;

23.verse: no longer be drinking water, but a little wine be using,  because of thy stomach and of thine often infirmities;

24.verse: of certain men the sins are manifest beforehand, leading  before to judgment, and certain also they follow after;

25.verse: in like manner also the right works are manifest  beforehand, and those that are otherwise are not able to be  hid.

1.verse: As many as are servants under a yoke, their own masters  worthy of all honour let them reckon, that the name of God and  the teaching may not be evil spoken of;

2.verse: and those having believing masters, let them not slight  [them], because they are brethren, but rather let them serve,  because they are stedfast and beloved, who of the benefit are  partaking. These things be teaching and exhorting;

3.verse: if any one be teaching otherwise, and do not consent to  sound words -- those of our Lord Jesus Christ -- and to the  teaching according to piety,

4.verse: he is proud, knowing nothing, but doting about questions and  word-striving, out of which doth come envy, strife,  evil-speakings, evil-surmisings,

5.verse: wranglings of men wholly corrupted in mind, and destitute of  the truth, supposing the piety to be gain; depart from such;

6.verse: but it is great gain -- the piety with contentment;

7.verse: for nothing did we bring into the world -- [it is] manifest  that we are able to carry nothing out;

8.verse: but having food and raiment -- with these we shall suffice  ourselves;

9.verse: and those wishing to be rich, do fall into temptation and a  snare, and many desires, foolish and hurtful, that sink men  into ruin and destruction,

10.verse: for a root of all the evils is the love of money, which  certain longing for did go astray from the faith, and  themselves did pierce through with many sorrows;

11.verse: and thou, O man of God, these things flee, and pursue  righteousness, piety, faith, love, endurance, meekness;

12.verse: be striving the good strife of the faith, be laying hold on  the life age-during, to which also thou wast called, and didst  profess the right profession before many witnesses.

13.verse: I charge thee, before God, who is making all things alive,  and of Christ Jesus, who did testify before Pontius Pilate the  right profession,

14.verse: that thou keep the command unspotted, unblameable, till the  manifestation of our Lord Jesus Christ,

15.verse: which in His own times He shall shew -- the blessed and  only potentate, the King of the kings and Lord of the lords,

16.verse: who only is having immortality, dwelling in light  unapproachable, whom no one of men did see, nor is able to  see, to whom [is] honour and might age-during! Amen.

17.verse: Those rich in the present age charge thou not to be  high-minded, nor to hope in the uncertainty of riches, but in  the living God, who is giving to us all things richly for  enjoyment; --

18.verse: to do good, to be rich in good works, to be ready to  impart, willing to communicate,

19.verse: treasuring up to themselves a right foundation for the time  to come, that they may lay hold on the life age-during.

20.verse: O Timotheus, the thing entrusted guard thou, avoiding the  profane vain-words and opposition of the falsely-named  knowledge,

21.verse: which certain professing -- concerning the faith did  swerve; the grace [is] with you. Amen.
